    • Method Detail

      • getAttrib

        public java.util.List<Attribute> getAttrib()
        List of Attributes that are associated with this element. This list is populated when we parse the XMI file.
        Returns:
        the list of attributes associated with this element.

      • getParentElem

        public XmiElement getParentElem()
        This method returns the parent Element to the Element
        Returns:
        parent element. null if this element doesn't have any Parent element

      • getChildElemList

        public java.util.List<XmiElement> getChildElemList()
        This method returns the list of ChildElements
        Returns:
        List of XmiElement this element is a parent of.

      • addChildElement

        public void addChildElement(XmiElement elem)
        We are building a tree and this points to all the child elements this Element has. ChildElem is a ArrayList and we add all the child Element as we parse the XMI file (Please refer to ParseXmi.java)
        Parameters:
        elem -

      • setParentElem

        public void setParentElem(XmiElement elem)
        We are building a tree and this points to the parent Element of this element. We make the determination of parent elements while parsing the XMI file. (refer to ParseXmi.java)
        Parameters:
        elem - : The element that is parent of this Element

      • getElementId

        public java.lang.String getElementId()
        Return the value of xmi:id attribute. This can be null
        Returns:
        This returns null if the xmi:id attribute is not present and return the xmi:id value if this attribute is present

      • getElementName

        public java.lang.String getElementName()
        Returns the name of the Element
        Returns:
        The name of the element

      • setFoundMatch

        public void setFoundMatch(boolean val)
        The problem with Papyrus is that keeps the elements in the UML diagram even though they have been removed. So in order to determine the active element we first the notation file and then parse the UML diagram. After we find the active Elements we mark with the flag found match is true.
        Parameters:
        val - - Indicating that a match was found

      • getFoundMatch

        public boolean getFoundMatch()
        Return if the element is active or not. This only applies to Elements that we parse in the .UML file. This flag doesn't apply to the .notation file
        Returns:

      • getAttributeValue

        public java.lang.String getAttributeValue(java.lang.String attribName)
